intro: Cyanea hirtella, commonly known as the hairy cyanea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Cyanea hirtella thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and lowland areas. It plays an important role in the ecological diversity of Hawaii's flora.
